definitions: To make someone feel unhappy or depressed.
To write something down; to record.
To swallow something, often with difficulty.
To start to seriously deal with something.
To enjoy oneself, especially by dancing.
examples: Please get down from the table.
Don't let the bad news get you down.
I need to get down these notes before I forget them.
This pill is hard to get down.
They really got down on the dance floor.
